author: holiman
content:
<@869907361085685780> I just synced a couple of azure nodes (IO isn't awesome on those). Without block download (because geth can sync with ancients intact from earlier), the account/storage snap download phase took on the order of 12 hours. 
```
synced=100.00% state=198.53GiB accounts=187,249,438@41.75GiB slots=765,336,548@152.83GiB codes=654,682@3.95GiB
```
The heal-phase depends heavily on 1) IO performance and 2) amount of peers. Too many peers overload the cli right now (we're working on it). For our more beefy aws-machines, we can usually do the whole thing in 12 hours. Can dig up some charts per phase for those later
